title.narrative: Implementation of the Nationally Determined Contribution of Nepal

description.narrative: Growth of transport sector and motorization – Demand for vehicles has grown by 14% per year during 1990-2015, with much of this concentrated in and around the Kathmandu Valley region. Sustained levels of population growth in Kathmandu, and the increasing prominence of the city’s economy mean that demand for mobility in the capital will remain high for the foreseeable future. Since the 2000s, air pollution in Nepali cities, particularly Kathmandu, has worsened considerably. Levels of particulate matter in the air around Kathmandu are now similar to those of Delhi and Beijing. A 2007 study found that air pollution lead to approximately 17,000 premature deaths in Kathmandu.
Support Nepal in sectoral NDC implementation by identifying financing options for NDC implementation, and commencing the implementation of the NDC at the local level with municipal agencies

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04543 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: "Implementation of the Nationally Determined Contribution of Nepal" - Project Results Report
Knowledge sharing events to build capacity for NDC implementation delivered

description.narrative: A detailed assessment of each municipality was undertaken over September ? December 2017, for finalization in early 2018. This assessment was based on both primary research undertaken in each municipality, as well as secondary sources. The assessment reviewed the economic, social and environmental dimensions of each municipality’s growth, and explored the institution, technical and financial management of the municipality. Based on this assessment, in close consultation with each municipality, a set of policy, planning and project initiatives and recommendations were made. Based on local and federal feedback, the Green Municipal Growth Assessments were completed in early February 2018, and approved by municipalities. In June 2018, the final knowledge sharing event of this project was conducted. This was a two-day workshop in Kathmandu. This workshop including 1.5 days of training sessions delivered to the mayors and other municipal leaders on key components of green municipal growth, including urban planning, asset mapping, financing and tax collection, environmental management and climate change. The final printed and translated Municipal Green Growth Assessments for the seven municipalities were presented as final products to the municipalities.

title.narrative: 2 knowledge sharing events conducted based on 1 knowledge product developed
Municipal level Project proposal approved for implementation and financed

description.narrative: A project proposal to deploy electric buses has been approved by Sajha Yatayat, the public bus operator. Discussions are ongoing with bus importer and distributer to acquire and operate buses. Financing is not yet secured.

title.narrative: 1 pilot electric bus project approved for implementation and financed in 1 municipality
Municipal level pilot project proposal on electric buses developed and submitted

description.narrative: In close consultation with Sajha Yatayat, a public bus operator, a feasibility study for the deployment of electric buses in Kathmandu was undertaken. The eighty-page report was completed in October 2017 and undertook a number of analyses including a passenger/kilometer analysis, a cost-benefit analysis, and a lifetime cost analysis. The report was approved in early 2018.

title.narrative: At least 1 pilot project proposal developed and submitted to government/investors
Increased public and private investment in climate mitigation and adaptation projects

1. Government successfully gains new access to financing sources (such as Green Climate Fund, Adaptation Fund) with GGGI support. 2. International and domestic private investments in climate mitigation and adaptation projects
Pipeline of bankable project ideas developed and submitted to GoN to advance Electric Mobility NDC implementation

description.narrative: Over the course of 2018, six bankable project ideas and one national financing vehicle idea have been originated and developed. All provide for key investments into the electric mobility ecosystem in Nepal. These project ideas required multiple rounds of stakeholder and bilateral consultations. Each project idea explores technical viability and undertakes preliminary financial analysis to determine IRR and cost recovery. The final project ideas were approved in early December 2018.

title.narrative: Pipeline of at least 5 bankable project ideas submitted to GoN
Sectoral plan for NDC implementation approved by GoN

description.narrative: The National Action Plan for Electric Mobility was launched by the Prime Minister on Oct 23, 2018. In addition, the following two outputs are endorsed by the government.

title.narrative: Government adopts NDC implementation plan for Electric Mobility
Increased knowledge for NDC implementation in priority sector(s)

description.narrative: Training conducted in 2018 with all seven participating municipalities, plus three additional guest municipalities. Knowledge of participants was built through 1.5 days of technical training

title.narrative: At least 70% of the participants who attend the training conducted report an increase in knowledge and skills for NDC implementation
Electric Mobility Implementation plan for NDC completed and submitted to GoN

description.narrative: With support from the Ministry of Physical Infrastructure and Transport (MOPIT) and the Ministry of Forests and Environment (MOFE), an implementation plan for the NDC’s electric mobility targets was finalized during the 1st quarter of 2018, based on extensive stakeholder consultations and data analyses carried out during 2017. It was originally published in English in April 2018, and the translation into Nepali is currently underway.

title.narrative: NDC implementation plan completed for Electric Mobility and submitted to GoN
